captions: 30 years of Cairo: Egyptâ€™s sprawling capital. Satellite-based images are useful in monitoring large scale urban development. The first image was captured by the US Landsat-5 in 1988, the second in 2018 and the third in 2021, both from the Copernicus Sentinel-2 mission.

slides.description: This image was acquired on 14 August 1988 and shows the city of Cairo and its surroundings more than 30 years ago (USGS/ESA)
slides.altText: This image was acquired on 14 August 1988 and shows the city of Cairo and its surroundings more than 30 years ago (USGS/ESA)

slides.description: This image was acquired on 2 August 2018 and shows the city of Cairo and its surroundings (contains modified Copernicus Sentinel data (2018))
slides.altText: This image was acquired on 2 August 2018 and shows the city of Cairo and its surroundings (contains modified Copernicus Sentinel data (2018))

slides.description: This image was acquired on 31 August 2021 and shows the city of Cairo and its surroundings (contains modified Copernicus Sentinel data (2021))
slides.altText: This image was acquired on 31 August 2021 and shows the city of Cairo and its surroundings (contains modified Copernicus Sentinel data (2021))
